questions.question_text: What is a characteristic of Wi-Fi channels?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
quite clearly B to be honest

Selected Answer: B
5GHz provide up to 31 channels

Selected Answer: B
B is correct answer

Selected Answer: D
There are 11 channels for 5

comments.content: And also for 2.4 Ghz, it is only 11 channels in the US (and a few other countries). In Europe, it is 13 channels, in Japan, I believe it is 14.

choices.B: Devices that connect to the same Wi-Fi channel reside in the same collision domain.
choices.C: Wi-Fi channels are spaced 30 MHz apart.
choices.D: The 5-GHz band offers 11 different channels for Wi-Fi clients.

questions.question_text: Which function is handled by vManage in the Cisco SD-WAN fabric?

choices.B: Performs remote software upgrades for WAN Edge, vSmart, and vBond.
choices.C: Distributes policies that govern data forwarding.
choices.D: Establishes BFD sessions to test liveliness of links and nodes.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
remote upgrades of SDWAN devices = vManage

C. Distributes policies that govern data forwarding.
This is correct. vManage is responsible for defining and distributing centralized policies that dictate how data is forwarded across the SD-WAN fabric

Selected Answer: B
Distributes policies that govern data forwarding is done by vSmart controller

Selected Answer: B
B is correct.

questions.question_text:
SIMULATION
-


Guidelines
-

This is a lab item in which tasks will be performed on virtual devices.

• Refer to the Tasks tab to view the tasks for this lab item.
• Refer to the Topology tab to access the device console(s) and perform the tasks.
• Console access is available for all required devices by clicking the device icon or using the tab(s) above the console window.
• All necessary preconfigurations have been applied.
• Do not change the enable password or hostname for any device.
• Save your configurations to NVRAM before moving to the next item.
• Click Next at the bottom of the screen to submit this lab and move to the next question.
• When Next is clicked, the lab closes and cannot be reopened.


Topology
-

//IMG//



Tasks
-

OSPF is preconfigured on all devices except R20. Configure R20 to complete these tasks.

Task 1:

Configure OSPF according to the topology using these requirements:

• Use Process ID 10.
• Use Loopback1 for the Router ID.
• Advertise all networks into OSPF.

o Use network statements under the OSPF process to accomplish this task.

Task 2:

Configure a /20 summary route for Area 40.

• Advertise only Type 3 LSAs into Area 0.


R20
-

//IMG//

discussion.content:
Task 1
!
router ospf 10
 router-id 2.2.2.2
 network 2.2.2.2 0.0.0.0 area 0
 network 10.10.20.0 0.0.0.255 area 0
 network 10.20.30.0 0.0.0.255 area 0
 network 10.40.50.0 0.0.0.255 area 40
!

Task 2
!
router ospf 10
 area 40 range 10.40.48.0 255.255.240.0
!

router ospf 10
router-id loopback1
network 10.10.20.0 0.0.0.255 area 0
network 10.20.30.0 0.0.0.255 area 0
network 10.40.50.0 0.0.0.255 area 40
area 40 range 10.40.48.0 255.255.240.0
area 40 filter-list prefix 10.40.0.0/16 out

comments.content:
The filter-list doesn't work with type 5 LSAs (external routes), only with type 3s (inter-area routes). 

Example from my lab:

R1(config)#do sh ip prefix 
ip prefix-list IA: 3 entries
 seq 5 deny 1.1.1.10/32
 seq 6 deny 10.10.10.0/24
 seq 10 permit 0.0.0.0/0 le 32
R1(config)#router ospf 1 
R1(config-router)#area 5 filter-list prefix IA out 

Neighbor switch, before list applied on R1:
SW1#sh ip ro ospf | inc O E2|O IA
O IA 1.1.1.10 [110/2] via 10.0.0.1, 00:00:17, Vlan10
O E2 10.10.10.0/24 [110/20] via 10.0.0.1, 00:02:38, Vlan10

Neighbor switch, after list is applied on R1:
SW1#sh ip ro ospf | inc O E2|O IA
O E2 10.10.10.0/24 [110/20] via 10.0.0.1, 00:02:54, Vlan10

discussion.content:
i will go for this.

router ospf 10
router-ID loopback1
network 10.20.30.0 0.0.0.255 area 0
network 10.10.20.0 0.0.0.255 area 0
netwiork 10.40.50.0 0.0.0.255 area 40
area 40 range 10.40.48.0 255.255.240.0

comments.content: area 40 is required as you are summarzing the route from that area

discussion.content: Do we need to include the 10.10.30.0/24 network? And I don't think it should be area 40 either way.

questions.question_text: Which JSON script is properly formatted?

discussion.content:
C is correct.
A is missing commas,
B has a comma on the last pair,
D is missing quotations

Selected Answer: B
Answer is B according to chatgpt

questions.question_text: What is a benefit of MACsec in a multilayered LAN network design?

choices.A: Application flows between hosts on the LAN to remote destinations can be encrypted.
choices.D: Layer 3 links between switches can be secured.
choices.B: Layer 2 trunk links between switches can be secured.
choices.C: There is no requirement to run IEEE 802.1X when MACsec is enabled on a switch port.
